Author: petra_ste
Review_Title: An interesting failure
Review: Ridley Scott directed one of the best movies ever made set during the Napoleonic Wars: unfortunately, that movie is not Napoleon but his cinematic debut, The Duellists, forty years ago.

Author: imseeg
Review_Title: A few words of warning for those with high expectations...
Review: A word of warning for those expecting another Gladiator or non stop action spectacle. It is not. Truly not...

Author: Eleatic67
Review_Title: Images without Words
Review: The success of any film depends mostly on the script. Why Scott would initiate such an expensive project without ensuring a refined and sophisticated script is a mystery. I'm not convinced there is a single interesting scene that provides insight into the characters or captures through language the prevailing political ideas. Scott's frequent missteps as a director reflect a greater interest in the cinematic rather than in the dramatic. However, this seems inevitable when your priority is delivering a blockbuster that will have broad appeal instead of digging deeper into culture, society, or history. A colossal waste of an extraordinary opportunity to create an important film about a fascinating historical figure.

Author: Vic_max
Review_Title: Expected an experience ... almost fell asleep
Review: Many of Ridley Scott's movies are like visual masterpieces with epic storylines. I was sort of expecting something like Gladiator. Instead, it was just "meh" - I probably would have quit watching if it was on TV.

Author: granka-47093
Review_Title: Stuff just happens...
Review:
Ridley Scott's Napoleon is a high-budget cinematic exercise in "Whatever, man, that'll do."
The film, both in terms of what it presents and how it presents, reeks of hollowness. Characters are shadows(not defined enough to even be considered parodies or mockeries of their real-life counterparts as some people like to see them), story is a shadow of a proper story( at times feeling as if written by A. I), atmosphere, with the exception of some of the battle scenes and the Russian segment, sterile and practically non existent(disasterous for Scott who is known to be one of the greatest world builders in history of the artform). Stuff just happens in the film. No significance or weight to anything or anybody... Sure, it's not all bad. The classic Ridley Scott elements are here - battles are engaging, the costumes and set designs very well-done. Something he can't help but always be good at.

Author: zeki-4
Review_Title: Bring on the director's cut!
Review: Back in 2005 Ridley Scott's 144 minute version of 'Kingdom of Heaven' premiered in theatres to somewhat mixed reviews. A couple of years later the vastly superior 190 minute director's cut version finally arrived, with the general consensus that the final product was a masterclass in storytelling, directing, acting and cinematography. - without doubt the best motion picture ever made about the crusades.

Author: stefan-huybrechts
Review_Title: Excellent trailer - not so the movie
Review: I will not get in to the historical inaccuracies, as in a lot of historical movies history is adapted for dramatic purposes. It is Hollywood after all and especially for big budget movies the goal is to make a lot of money. Beautiful Trailer.

Author: dorMancyx
Review_Title: Tsk Tsk Tsk
Review: I feel unsatisfied walking out of that theater after three hours of melancholy and confusion. I understand every single word and every single scene, but when they connect into a whole film I don't understand anything. To start off, the costume/production design, naturalistic sceneries, the two meticulously-depicted ancient warfares --- one amid the doleful squall of Austerlitz and another atop the dampened prairie of Waterloo --- and all other technical stuff are spotless. However, there's an anxiety-inducing problem with the narrative --- the movie has no focus. No climax, no resonating themes like Oppenheimer, just one plain, linear, chronological plot; and even that we get multiple baffling time jumps throughout. The plot is so simple that everything in the film was taught in my AP World History class last year in one day, except it nibbles on some superficial details. Highlighting the relationship between Napolean and Josephine is a unique take, and I do see efforts from the two esteemed performers to capture their mutual toxicity and intricacy, but this love story has barely anything to do with the movie's main arc, Napolean's personal rise and fall. Nothing! Two basically unrelated storylines unfolding in the most bland way possible. Also adding to this insipid mess is the score, which is composed primarily of classical or really old-sounding French folk --- what happened to Radiohead from the trailer? God Ridley I don't wanna say three hours of my life is wasted but it kinda is!

Author: UrsusProblemus
Review_Title: Another reminder to not care about people's opinions ever again
Review: Yes, the film is somewhat disjointed. It would have been much better off being a mini-series. However, apart from that, I can't really fault the movie, and it's an absolute mystery to me why everyone seems to hate it so much. Granted, I can't really judge its historical accuracy, I'm merely speaking about its merits as a drama. Well, it's beautifully shot and it never gets dull. And it's still way above average. I would definitely rank it higher than Scott's "Last Duel", too.

Author: cagebox111
Review_Title: Napoleon the butcher, Napoleon the megalomaniac, Napoleon the lover
Review: Napoleon was the most significant man of his age and no film can explain his significance in 2.5 hours. Scott decides to focus on three specific aspects of Napoleon's life and personality to show who he thinks Napoleon was at the expense of omitting much of what makes him such a fascinating figure in history.

Author: epicking
Review_Title: Tired of Romanticized and incorrect Historical movies
Review: Im only focused on the historical aspect here ... and I only mentions a couple of out many here

Author: adamneale-73636
Review_Title: 2 hours 38 minutes is not enough for this story!
Review: This is an incredibly ambitious film, telling the story of Napoleon Bonaparte from the French Revolution through to his rise to Emperor, The Battle of Austerlitz, the Russia campaign, Waterloo and his final exile, all while dedicating many scenes to Napoleon's relationship with Josephine.

Author: strunckjl
Review_Title: Save your money on this one
Review: Like many on here, I was thrilled with the trailer and couldn't wait for this movie to hit the theaters.

Author: dhunjiwadia
Review_Title: Ridley Scott's Napoleon is more hysterical than historical.
Review: Ridley Scott's Napoleon is more hysterical than historical. History is like an uninvited guest in this movie. Stunning battle visuals don't make up for gross historical approximations.

Author: nicula-eduard-andrei
Review_Title: A shallow representation
Review: When i first heard about Ridley Scott making a Napoleon movie with Joaquin Phoenix as lead actor, i was very excited. Little that i knew that this movie would not match the expectations set. First of all i would like to state that i didn't expect an historically accurate movie given the fact that it is not Ridley Scott strongest suite (see Kingdom of Heaven). There is a small measure of truth in all of his movies but they are not built as a documentary and they are not intended to be one. Nevertheless, this movie doesn't even come close to the vibe given by Kingdom of Heaven or other historical movies, from an historical point of view. I always look for a particular type of energy in movies, especially in historical ones but Napoleon in my opinion fails to deliver. This movie tries to much to contain all peculiarities of Napoleon's life but fails miserably. We see all and nothing. The feeling that i got was that we saw a fast forward version of his life but without any soul or essence. Even the battle scenes seemed dull and without soul. I think Ridley set the bar too high through his previous movies for this part. Regarding Joaquin's performance, there is not much to say. I think his interpretation was similar to a performance you would see in a stage theater. I don't know why but at some points in the movie, it felt like a low budget movie with very poor writing and very poor dialogue. I will wait for the extended version to see if my opinion changes for the best.

Author: garrywt
Review_Title: Should have been a 10 part series
Review: There's so much available content to tell this story. Why the hell was it a 2.5 hour film rather than the multi part limited series it deserves to be? The film has over 20 years of history to cover but includes so many huge time skips that you can't help feeling that you're missing out on a huge amount. This should have been a series and given the writers and the actors the time they deserved to tell the story properly but instead we get something that seems rushed and has huge gaps in time where things are shunted forward just se we can reach the end of the story before time runs out. The acting is above par (Despite Phoenix mumbling through some scenes) and the action sequences are excellent but there is just a feeling that it could have been so much more.

Author: jmperfetti
Review_Title: Looks Epic, does NOT FEEL EPIC
Review: Most people will agree that this film is visually stunning. The sets, the wardrobe, the battle scenes. All of the imagery is amazingly beautiful.

Author: Vince_D
Review_Title: It was OK but messy - Maybe the 4-hour cut is better?
Review: I went in wanting and expecting to like it but came out thinking it was a disjointed mess.

Author: astallabrass
Review_Title: Don't be put off by the reviews!
Review: I put my hands up to say I'm not a historian so whether or not this film misses out on factual detail, I'm not sure. I also didn't see the trailer which a lot of people seemed to get excited as if it were to be a contender to stand next to Gladiator.

Author: Masami-J
Review_Title: A film I don't recommend
Review: Napoleon by Ridley Scott is a film about Napoleon Bonaparte, but it is a very fictional film, many sequences of the film do not correspond to historical reality. I didn't like the film because I would have preferred something much more historically faithful, not an almost fictional work.

Author: Xstal
Review_Title: Nap-oleon...
Review: A battle in Toulon sets up your rise, as the rebels are soon cannonballed to size, with some help and some removed, promotions are approved, sets your trajectory to take you to the skies; the pyramid of your life is Josephine, while on manoeuvres she's quite progressive and keen, although quite barren for an Empress, and you need an heir for success, but you compensate through a mass killing machine. A spell in exile lets you gather next to water, before you gather once again to kill and slaughter, but no matter what you do, this will be your Waterloo, as all you dreams go down the pan, prisoned by water.

Author: MissSimonetta
Review_Title: My biggest disappointment this year
Review: Ridley Scott's NAPOLEON feels like the highlight reel of a lengthy miniseries. Considering there's a 4-hour cut of this film, that explains it all.

Author: Sleepin_Dragon
Review_Title: Ignore the negatives, it's an impressive movie.
Review: The rise and fa of French Emperor Napoleon Bonaparte, who's thirst for power led him to many victories and some significant losses.

Author: reelreviewsandrecommendations
Review_Title: Are You Not Entertained?
Review: Do films about figures from reality need to be entirely factual? The fractious reaction to Ridley Scott's 'Napoleon' seems to suggest that some, at least, think they do. However, in his book 'Hero: The Life and Legend of Lawrence of Arabia,' Michael Korda posits that criticizing a film- in his case David Lean's epic 'Lawrence of Arabia'- for a lack of historical accuracy "misses the point (as) the object was to produce, not a faithful docudrama that would educate the audience, but a hit picture."

Author: krzysiektom
Review_Title: Awful.
Review: What a disappointment. This film is BORING. A movie with a huge budget, good actors, about a person as fascinating and complex as Bonaparte, who participated in more than 60 battles and had drama, triumphs and failures that would be enough for a few lifetimes, is... BORING! Nothing is well explained, it's unclear who is who beside Napoleon and Josephine. Several unnecessary sex scenes between the two. What's even worse is that it's unclear why the French nation would follow and worship this Napoleon as he's portrayed in this movie, because in this movie he seems a mediocre personality, without much charisma or extraordinary abilities. In addition, everything on the screen looks greyish blue, without vivid colors, and it is a bit depressing. I liked only two elements of this movie: musical score and costumes.

Author: egruber130
Review_Title: Would Have Been Better as a Miniseries
Review: As usual, Phoenix is very good, but there just seems to be something missing from his character. More importantly, a story of such epic proportions is much better suited as a miniseries (along the lines of HBO's John Adams). In fairness, as other reviewers have mentioned, the Apple TV version was almost 4 hours long, so the theatrical version had to be cut by almost 2 hours. The result leaves the viewer trying to decipher the timeline and fill in missing details as the story leapfrogs huge gaps of time. Napoleon's character is complex and he's shown as brave, scared, sniveling, proud, steadfast and prideful. Without the full story, that odd mixture of traits is a little confusing, despite Phoenix's strengths.

Author: trevjohns
Review_Title: Should have been called Napoleon and Josephine
Review: This should have been called "Napoleon and Josephine" because, frankly, there's too much of Josephine in it, and not nearly enough of the brilliance and personality of Bonaparte. The historical inaccuracies are manifold. I read that director Scott says that "If you weren't there then you can **** off". Well I was not there, but the erroneous simplification of one of history's greatest characters shows Scott wasn't there either. The battle scenes are gaining accolades, but even they shouldn't. Wrong and over simplified. If you are going to make a movie about Napoleon, his generalship should have taken centre-stage, not his domestic tussles with the Missus. A grand disappointment. An artilleryman, as Napoleon was, taking part in a cavalry charge? I don't think so! Oh, how I wish Kubrick had carried through to make his version. I give this six stars, mostly for having the courage to take on such a mighty story. Too bad it fell far short of its subject matter.

Author: Ezpl8yer
Review_Title: Just like Napoleon himself, Ridley Scott overreaches
Review: With every biopic, the question is always: how do you condense a person's life in a 2 or 3 hour motion picture? However, simultaneously, you have to have enough material to make a film out off. With a figure like Napoleon, the balance clearly shifts to having so much material to work with that one cinematic release may not be enough to satisfactorily portray the man's life. While this concern was already there before release, we have seen great movies about bigger-than-life men and women succeed like Gandhi (1982). And with a director like Ridley Scott, you want to give the project the benefit of the doubt. Unfortunately, The movie falls into the trap that has haunted other biopics which is a lack of focus. In other words, instead of elucidating a character's life, we get a collection of highlights about that character's history which doesn't build up to an overall great experience.

Author: skybiscuits
Review_Title: Yeah, nah
Review: Dog's breakfast of a movie. It was allover the shop. It feels like they only shot half the movie and just stitched it together. Out of all the movies this year this is one of them.

Author: esyurt
Review_Title: Great balance of action and drama.
Review: The movie consists of a beautiful balance of drama and action. For those who like action you will not be disappointed the war scenes are amazing. I feel as though those giving low ratings are just salty because of the depiction of napoleon I'm not a historian but I would assume they tried to capture his personality as close to reality as they could and this may have offended the frenchies. The only thing negative I can say is that the timeline is excessively shortened in order to fit the movie time limit, it's a shame these historic movies aren't filmed over multiple movies to retain intricate detail.

Author: vsek
Review_Title: Napoleon?
Review: This should have been Ridley Scott's Lawrence of Arabia or Gandhi. But it wasn't.

Author: levybob
Review_Title: Knew it was Bad. Even so, Surprised at HOW bad.
Review: I read the reviews of Ridley Scott's 'Napoleon' and knew it was not the great film everyone anticipated. Even so, I went. And what I discovered is that it's bad in the worst kind of way; It is dull. Lifeless. A flat un-involving story about characters who are in every way unlikable. Another reviewer wrote that he / she had trouble staying awake through its 2 hours 40 minutes run-time. When I read that I laughed. Now that I have seen the film, I am laughing no longer.

Author: groeneveld-39547
Review_Title: good movie. ignore the bad reviews!
Review: In my oppion its a very good movie that they involveld the love letters between Napoleon and Josephine.

Author: WadoodS
Review_Title: Napoleon Deserved Better
Review: Making a movie on a charismatic person like Napoleon is a huge undertaking. It requires in-depth study of his life and then choosing specific events of his life to show and connecting them to perfection. The film maker is short in time therefore it is important for the movie to be precise, fluent and with a purpose. In this movie, the director, Ridley Scott, fails to determine which points of his life he wishes to portray and consequently it results in a piece-by-piece movie which lacks cinematic flow and confuses the audience.

Author: frogcilfruit
Review_Title: Why bother with actual history...
Review: ...when you can use a famous historical figure for publicity and just make up an alternate story that better fits your views, whims, or "vision" ?

Author: semihseftali
Review_Title: They should have named the movie "Josephine", not "Napoleon".
Review: The movie tells only one part of Napoleon's story; Crazy Dictator and does everything for his love - which I believe is wrong. In reality, especially at the beginning of his life, Napoleon was a very succesful statesman. During his time many ideas of revolution are settled. Many developments in social and economic life are realized. I could not see these things in the movie. This film can be named "Josephine" instead of Napoleon .

Author: adambarta
Review_Title: Hollywood overtaking over quality
Review: Once I found out that there will be a movie about Napoleon starring Joaquin Phoenix, I got excited. What a great idea? It's one of the most interesting people in history, of course this would make a great movie.

Author: diponsakib
Review_Title: A Triumphant Look at Ridley Scott's "Napoleon"
Review: Ridley Scott has once again tackled a titan of history, and with "Napoleon," he delivers a film as epic and intoxicating as its subject. Joaquin Phoenix channels the Corsican whirlwind with electrifying intensity, capturing not just Napoleon's military genius but also his volatile spirit, plagued by ambition and haunted by shadows.

Author: edgecumbedrake
Review_Title: Amazing Cinematography, Sloppy Pacing.
Review: Another great film by Ridley Scott. The cinematography, sets, and acting all al superb. Joaquin Phoenix, although he might have not been the best casting for a 22 year old. The Battle of Austerlitz really showcases Ridley Scott's amazing eye for shots. But even with all of that, there are some bad things. Around halfway through the film, the pacing really slows down. It is still very much enjoyable, but it could definitely be improved upon. One thing that distracted me from the plot were the scenes between Joaquin Phoenix and Vannessa Kirby's characters, where Napoleon was making animal sounds while trying to impregnate her. Overall, I enjoyed the film. A solid 8/10.

Author: reeceagland
Review_Title: Like Napolean taking Moscow a long slog that starts strong but ultimately fails.
Review: Joaquin Phoenix is amazing and carries this film like Napolean carried France, but in the end it was not enough.

Author: LongTimeMovieLover
Review_Title: BAD, REALLY BAD, TERRIBLY BAD, AND I WILL EXPLAIN
Review: First, let me get this out of the way. If you want to watch a focused masterpiece, watch Waterloo with Rod Steiger and Christopher Plummer. It could have only been better (for me) if Steiger had a French accent. Second, if you want to watch a general scoping history of Napoleon, consider the excellent and approachable Napoleon series with Christian Clavier (with a French accent), Isabella Rossallini, John Malkovich and Gerard Depardieu. (Clavier is sometimes unfairly maligned when indeed he does a splendid job in my view.) There are other well-reputed less approachable versions, but these two are excellent.

Author: brucesarn-36583
Review_Title: A King By Another Name
Review: A Hollywood film tells a story, it entertains. It pads fact with artistic licence. A documentary film tells a factual story, it is not always designed to entertain, but to educate. None of us know anything about the reality of Napoleons life, we surmise, film makers interpret.

Author: joerg-vogeltanz
Review_Title: Superficial and one-dimensional
Review: "Napoleon" leaves you completely indifferent and emotionally cold. In my opinion, this is the disappointment of the movie year so far. Phoenix is tragically underchallenged and grunts unmotivatedly through the "plot" when he's not ramming Josephine like a billy goat or sleeping standing up (I fear that this excellent actor's eyes had actually closed in the face of this direction). Sure, very beautiful images and sceneries, beautiful costumes, you can feel the huge amount of money there. But imho the whole movie is just like a series of expensive reenactments for a embarassingly sloppy researched documentary, only without a documentary in between. There is not a single truly credible interaction between the characters, the "love story" between Josephine and Napoleon is completely superficial (not to mention the incomprehensible idea of making the actress playing Josephine appear much younger than Napoleon, while in historical reality she was over 10 years older). Basically, this film is nothing more than a rushed sequence of the "best of" stations from Napoleon's life that can be found in any history book (whereby really important stations such as the discovery of the "Rosetta Stone" are simply swept under the table), but unfortunately it is soulless and lovelessly realised. Any hint of motivation or drama is nipped in the bud. The admittedly impressive battle scenes (which are also reeled off without any deeper emotion) can't really save the day. And then the announcement that there will be an "in-depth lesson", so to speak, via streaming service... I see that as a pure rip-off and a major weakness of a director as originally excellent as Ridley Scott.

Author: javier_arriagada94
Review_Title: Disappointing/Misleading
Review: When you see the trailer for this movie you get really high expectations, but then you watch it...

Author: itsahoverboard
Review_Title: "I don't know what to do." - Joaquin Phoenix, ten days before start Napoleon production
Review: Yes, that's a real quote from Joaquin Phoenix to Ridley Scott right before they started filming. I love Joaquin Phoenix, but you can really tell that he doesn't "get" the character of Napoleon that he's trying to play. I honestly don't know if Phoenix even has that kind of charisma and confidence within him, but then again I don't know anything about Napoleon either. But it was just uncomfortable watching him stumble his way through the movie, often just looking clueless.

Author: SnoopyStyle
Review_Title: epic Ridley Scott biopic
Review: It's 1793. Army officer Napoleon Bonaparte (Joaquin Phoenix) watches Queen Marie Antoinette's execution by guillotine. The port of Toulon is under blockage by the British and Napoleon leads the campaign to liberate it. Revolutionary leader Maximilien Robespierre is deposed and executed for his Reign of Terror. Napoleon leads the troupes to suppress the royalists. He meets aristocratic widow Joséphine de Beauharnais (Vanessa Kirby).

Author: anthonydesmondolivier
Review_Title: Better than the reviews
Review: I am fascinated with both the French Revolution and the rise of Napoleon, and have dedicated more hours than I should to understand this history.

Author: apereztenessa-1
Review_Title: Innovative in its way to depict a historic legend
Review: Napoleon has been a surprise hit, and how much ink has been spent on the film may be one reason for its success. Rarely in recent history has a film been so widely criticized for its historical inaccuracies. We didn't hear that kind of backlash for The Crown or Bridgerton, so why such disappointment in historic representation in this specific case?

Author: sue-06239
Review_Title: Went reluctantly but I enjoyed it
Review: I went to see this despite not really fancying it but my husband was desperate to see it. I came away having enjoyed it much more than expected.

Author: albertalvarez2k
Review_Title: Exceptional period piece.
Review: Although not Shakespearean, nor is there much French tongue, this movie delivers a convincing portrayal of European aristocracy of the 1790s and early 1800s. Gorgeously fathomed costumes, grand architecture and brutal battle scenes where if you blink you might miss a startling effect. There is also some slomo battle sequences which are welcomed as well. Well paced movie for entertainment value. Its not a deep dive into the ins and outs of European politics of the late 18th century, but a well rounded portrayal of the reign of Napoleon. Like a greatest hits album of his reign. The famous battle of Waterloo is also portrayed, having the most on screen battalions in formation I can think of. More so than the battles in the Gettysburg movie. But not as many cannon. Gettysburg has an awesome cannonade sequence that is the best put to film yet. Like 2 minutes straight of cannon firing. I love it. But, yes, the battles in Napoleon deliver striking effects and large processions of armies slaughtering each other with musket and bayonet.

Author: david-meldrum
Review_Title: Agreeably Undemanding Historical Epic
Review: Ridley Scott's Napoleon biopic is an agreeable Easter Day afternoon watch; an engaging blend of high camp, bloody spectacle, and pretension puncturing humour. Phoenix is well cast for this take on Napoleon; whilst his Emperor lacks a sort of predatory danger that the script hints at, his performances lances pomposity and is devoid of po-faced seriousness. Vanessa Kirby is the one who really shines as Josephine, however; every minute she's not on screen feels a little less than it could be.

Author: nlcckc
Review_Title: Well that was painful
Review: So here is a film about one of the greatest warlords of history, and what do you suppose it emphasizes? If your guess is the yucky "relationship" he had with Josephine, you're not far from the truth.

Author: housermichael
Review_Title: Another Great Ridley Scott Film
Review: I have been a huge fan of Ridley Scott as a director for a long time, since I saw "Alien" back in 1979. Since then he has directed several great movies such as "Blade Runner", "Legend", "Someone to Watch over me", "Black Rain", "Thelma and Louise", "Gladiator", "Black Hawk Down", and "The Martian".

Author: boutzarelis
Review_Title: More is less. It should have been 2 movies
Review: More like a montage of fast paced stories throughout the life of Napoleon rather than a biography movie of the person. Allways too obsessed with Josephine and with little to no coherence at all between scenes. It takes you from Paris to Egypt and back in less than five minutes and three scenes. It doesn't explain any of his action and we almost never see the immediate consequences of them, it just changes scene upon scene with nothing connecting them other than years passed. Phoenix acts good but and the visuals are excellent but it comes out too shallow and rushed and empty. I guess a director's cut with about 2 hours more material (that will double the length of the movie) is the only thing that will fix it.

Author: malmevik77
Review_Title: What's the French word for crap?
Review: Napoleon

Author: exceladeogun
Review_Title: Feels like a teaser for something grand
Review: Napoleon

Author: stevelivesey-37183
Review_Title: Not perfect but very entertaining.
Review: There is quite the mixed bag here. It really should be called Napoleon and Josephine as this the main plot point in the movie.

Author: bjhex1
Review_Title: Plodding military history and a lifeless 'passionate' romance
Review: I would have to say that this film might be best for people who know nothing about Napoleon. Not for the liberties it takes (and those are myriad in the film), but that it is so methodical in its presentation. Starting with the narrative subtitles, explaining in broad strokes the French Revolution and identifying major players, the audience is already being told not to overly worry about subtext. And it becomes clear early on, that the intention is not to humanize Napoleon, as much as de-mythologize him, to the extent of humiliation.

Author: felipearielm
Review_Title: It's not what we asked for.
Review: The film is not the epic you are expecting, it's not a history lesson (thank God) and it's not as bad as you think. Of course, the film has a lot of problems, it's a little bit confusing and disorganized, the main characters are not deeply developed, so many of the premisses of the plot are not so convincing. Despite the feeling that it could have been better, watching Napoleon was far from being the bad experience many told me it would be. I wonder if this unusual aproache by Scott wasn't influenced by the bad box office from The Last Duel. Anyways, solid 8/10 in my opinion. I have a feeling the extended director's cut will be quite different and better film.

Author: rallymarc
Review_Title: A Disappointment
Review: I just watched this on the big screen and have to say that the only merit to it is the way Scott handles the battle scenes. The first campaign in Russia is breathtaking as is Waterloo.

Author: heisenberg12
Review_Title: 2 Hours Wasted on Josephine
Review: The title says it all. When anyone thinks about Napolean, they automatically think of the general, the egomaniacal conquerer, military genius who glorified and unified France after the French Revolution.

Author: RightOnDaddio
Review_Title: Who Knew There Were This Many French History Scholars and Napoleon Devotees Here Writing Movie Reviews? I Know Not As Much But I Know This Napoleon is Dyn-O-Mite!
Review: Okay, so maaaybe this film isn't a documentary. Maybe it's not one hundred percent on the factual side.

Author: jaredmarkherbert
Review_Title: Ridley Scott's Napoleon: An Epic yet Unsatisfactorily Incomplete Biography of the Legendary Leader
Review: An arguably good attempt at displaying the imperialistic ambitions and militaristic prowess that is Napoleon Bonaparte. However, despite the depiction of fantastic battle scenes, the film tends to jump around a bit and is not effectively woven together as to bring Napoleon's entire narrative into one seamless, cohesive piece for the audience. There are also many relevant historical facts missing from the film, including some large and other minute details that could have easily been sprinkled in. This in spite of the movie being roughly 2 hours & 40 minutes long. As a counterpoint, Director Ridley Scott never claimed to make the movie completely historically factual; and the film is debatably more historically anchored than a lot of other films which claim to be "based on true events".

Author: rachelnstephens
Review_Title: Snapshots of Napoleon's life
Review: If I knew nothing of Napoleon, I'd be utterly confused about what was happening in this film. There is no hero's journey to follow and nobody to root for.

Author: ciaransweeney-25817
Review_Title: The reviews here are very harsh
Review: I have just arrived home from the cinema from seeing this film. I was worried I was not going to enjoy it after reading some of the reviews on here, but I must say I really enjoyed the film.

Author: Rms88
Review_Title: Not What I Expected!
Review: I was somewhat disappointed in Ridley Scott's movie as it was not what I expected. The movie dragged for the first hour. It didn't focus much on historical and political details. It also lacked much fighting in the battlefield, especially not displaying Napoleon's tactical and genius strategy. His rise and fall lacked the specifics in a lightning fashion. In addition, it didn't seem historically accurate as it also didn't concentrate on his mistakes such as the Continental System and the outrage of the French people after crowning himself King. The French Revolution was about overthrowing a monarch, yet he crowns himself king. The entire movie focused on his beloved wife, Josephine. It was more of a love story.

Author: bnrztyxsz
Review_Title: A joke for a joker.
Review: The production should have budgeted few bucks to seek help from a Napoleonic era expert, thus to avoid the succession of historical inaccuracies.

Author: andrei1981-1
Review_Title: Ridley Scott is such a trickster
Review: Ridley Scott has tricked me. I really thought I was going to watch a movie about Napoleon. But two hours into it I realized I'm actually watching a movie about the English. Scott made short shrift of Napoleon's victories and spent 40 minutes on Waterloo. One of the greatest tactical minds in history and the man who terrorized the whole of Europe is reduced here to a grotesque caricature. Phoenix, otherwise an excellent actor, lacks charisma as Napoleon and the two protagonists (Napoleon and Josephine) have zero chemistry. Given the hype created around it, I consider the movie a flop. Scott has fallen knee deep into the trap of artistic hubris, as he arrogantly believes he's entitled to remake and reshape historical figures with impunity. If he wants full freedom, there's always fiction, an endless reservoir of stories, but when you're bringing to the screen one of the most (in)famous characters in history, more reverence is needed. Scott's iconoclastic bravado is now being punished by the public. It makes me very nervous to think that he's working on a new Gladiator. That's truly bad news.

Author: UniqueParticle
Review_Title: Very enjoyable
Review: This is an extraordinary film. Sure it's got flaws, but to me, the only one is it is a bit boring at times otherwise so damn good! Stupendous Imax for sound and beautiful scenery. I'm not entirely sure why this got some hate - it's a great movie especially Joaquin's performance and holy cow Vanessa Shaw is stunning - she was a great addition to everything! The war bits were excellent, the set design/clothes were all impressive, some of it was goofy which was unexpected, and the acting alone deserves recognition. I think it's cute how plenty of old folks go to see this I'm 31 though I enjoyed a lot of the movie my only problem is it was a little slow at times.

Author: dannytoldyaso
Review_Title: Being reviewed bombed by Ms Marvel fans.
Review: The Ms Marvle fans out here really mad at this movie. Telling people not to go see it on thanksgiving as a family film even for older adults. They are creepy and wierd asf. Don't even get me started on Zegler trolls in here review bombing as well cause they are just unlikable as she is. Well let's get to the core of the film this is a masterpiece! The practical effects in this are soooo good this helps cleanse the pallet after decades of green screen super hero's! We have a refreshing new look in to Napoleon! Joaquin Phoenix doesn't win an Oscar again or at least get a nod from the guild then the Oscar's are truly dead, well when you pick Jimmy Kimmel to be the front man then you know they are dead. Anyways this is masterpiece! Go watch it! Sorry I got sidetracked in this review!

Author: gmznffvs
Review_Title: Desperately disappointing.
Review: Napoleon is one of the greatest characters in history. He came out of the ashes of the French Revolution to not only lead the country but to inspire it. People were given new hope, aspirations and above all opportunities.

Author: jojosifi
Review_Title: One of the best cinematography shots ever
Review: As a history enjoyer on a regular basis this is a must watch! Joaquin Phoenix portraying Napoleon in a mesmerising way, the characterisation a exaggerating but fitting portrayal, and the cinematography WOW! Almost every shot could be captured into a neoclassical dynamic oil painting, which i think is perfect regarding napoleon preferences and the artistic aspect of the movie. Using element of repoussiour, usage of heroic scenes (placement of napoleon), the overall angles were astonishing!

Author: 1930s_Time_Machine
Review_Title: Carry On Conquering
Review: Although it's impossible to do justice to the life of M Bonaparte in just over a couple of hours, Ridley Scott nevertheless has made a thoroughly enjoyable, satisfying piece of entertainment. It's ultra-light on history but a brilliant character study.

Author: gcarpiceci
Review_Title: History is an undesired guest in Mr Scott's movie
Review: History is an undesired guest taking the backseat in Mr Scott's sprawling epic on Napoleon's life.
